name: Melia Las Antillas

reviews.text: I stayed at this resort during September 2005 and have to say I was extremely disappointed with it. The hotel itself is desperate for a major maintenance programme.
reviews.title: Not Worth the Money Go Somewhere Else

reviews.text: In the brochure it was rated as 4 star. This is a major exageration and I would rate it as no more than a 2 star. I had 2 dealings with the Reception staff - booking in and booking out and both were bad experiences. On booking in I was actually wondering if they knew what they were doing and booking out, the person who booked me out never said one word to me from start to finish (that is not exagerating!!) Talk about customer relations and trying to get people back.
reviews.title: Cuba fantastic, Beaches Varadero not 4 star

reviews.text: The staff were ok but I must admit I have been treated better in other resorts over the years. I will not go on and on as it is all negative and all I want to do is advise people not to waste their money on this holiday and book somewhere else.
reviews.title: It was awful!!

reviews.text: It certainly is NOT a 4 star hotel as I am used to and those that are saying how wonderful it is, obviously haven't experienced proper 4 star hotels/holidays and I would suggest they try somewhere else before going back to this one.
reviews.title: Had a great holiday but wouldn't rush back

reviews.text: Cuba is fantastic. We started with 3 days at the 5 star Nacional Hotel in Havana. There was so much to see and do. All the Cubans we spoke to were so glad that we’d actually seen the ‘real’ Cuba rather than just going to a resort hotel. It was wonderful, amazing, fabulous etc. We would return to Cuba anytime and be happy to eat in Cuban restaurants as we did in Havana and in the town of Varadero – great, cheap food.
reviews.title: keeping it short

reviews.text: We booked our trip to Beaches Varadero with some reservations based on the reviews we read here, but went anyways hoping that our experience would be different. We should have listened to the reviews (we only stayed 2 nights and had our tour rep move us to another resort ... the Barcelo Marina Palace - was fantastic!)

We have just returned from the resort and decided to give out some info on our visit.
reviews.title: Not One To Remember

reviews.text: Most of the staff are friendly, except for one or two at the reception. Drinks are plentiful, especially if you ask for the real stuff otherwise they will serve you the local brew. A great beach but I don't know where they get the idea it is rated in the worlds top Ten. As mentioned in earlier reviews the water sports are included but you hardly ever get to do any, I suppose it depends on whether the instructors had a late night previously!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Fun, But a Couple of Disappointments
reviews.text: Our room was clean and tidy on arrival but was only skimmed over by the maids for the rest of our stay.The curtain was coming away from the rail, and we had no hot water for the last 3 days except an occasional trickle. Room 4104 you have been warned. When we spoke at reception about it they sent somebody up straight away....the barman Julio Caesar. He came in turned on the tap and said in broken english " It's not working!!!" They said there were no other rooms at first until I complained further, we then had the use of several rooms but only for showering at certain times, not what should be happening at a supposedly 4* resort.

reviews.title: Loved Cuba, Not the resort so much
reviews.text: Thermal mugs were a good idea and well worth taking with you, it saves numerous trips to the bar!

reviews.title: beaches varadaro
reviews.text: Slight smell from the Lagoon but not as bad as some make it out to be. Overnight trip to Havana and Tropicana a must, but don't be fooled into buying your cigars there, regardless of what the guide tells you, they are cheaper at the airport duty free. I found out to my cost. Take a trip out in the evening to Varadero, "Club 62" on street 62 funny enough is a great place to visit, good music and by around 11pm the place is in full swing with all the locals dancing in the street. Just to finish off I thought the resort was no more than 3*, it's O.K saying well it's Cuba and they don't have a lot but at the end of the day the "Sandals" company put there name to it, this has to be one of there worse. Someone previously said that you should see how the locals live and think yourself lucky, however, and fortunately, I don't live like that, and expect better for my hard earned money. Yes it's a third world country, but so is Africa and there's far better resorts their. I know this write up is mainly negative, but that is how we feel, having waited nearly a year for our holiday it was ultimately a disappointment.

reviews.title: Not bad at all
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 10 night stay at Beaches and even though the holiday was marred by Hurricanne Wilma & Beta and massive flight delays we still managed to have a great time in the clouds!!!!

reviews.title: ignore all the negative reviews of this hotel
reviews.text: I must say from reading previous messages over the past few months that I was getting very worried about spending our well earned holiday and cash there. Yes the place could do with a lick of paint and the food was not the greatest in the buffet, but what do people expect they are in Cuba!!! Did the moaners have a look at what the locals had to live in!!!!

On the whole I found the hotel to be very clean with daily maid service whom we tipped daily although we didnt need to. Try and eat in the specialised restaurants although spaces are limited as they are definatley better than the buffet. The staff were very freindly and did there best to entertain us even on rainy days which unfortunatley there were a few!
reviews.title: My Beaches Varadero Review - Good Experience
We had a great time!!!
reviews.text: I have learnt to make your own mind up about these places and dont let these bad reviews spoil your holiday before its even begun.

description: All Inclusive Four–Star Plus beach resort covering an area of 6 000 m², with rooms distributed in a modern fivestory building and thee-story bungalows.The hotel is situated beachfront, 35 km from the Varadero airport; 40 km form the city of Matanzas and the Tropicana Matanzas Cabaret; 14 km from the town center; 4.5 km from the Plaza America Convention Center; 5 km from the Varadero Golf Club and only 100 metros from the Dolphinarium.Located in Varadero facing a fabulous strip of beach• Comfortable and cool ambience• Conceived only for adults and youths over 16 years of age.• Central building and bungalows surrounded by green areas and gardens with artificial lakes, pergolas and small wooden bridges.• Main lobby with natural hanging gardens offering a beautiful view of the second lobby on the ground floor and of the manicured hotel gardens.• Junior Suites with balconies offering views of the swimming pool and the surrounding hotel gardens.• Large swimming pool with Jacuzzi, cascades, wading area and platforms with palapas for relaxing or administering massages.• Recreation area and outdoor amphitheater, ideal for a varied cultural activities• Terraces -gardens, with promenades, pergolas, palapas, lakes and parking area for greater enjoyment of outdoor activities.• Varied culinary offers with à la carte and buffet restaurants, bars and fun pub.• VIP Area, offering exclusive services and attentions to clients accommodated in Junior Suites Superior and Suites
